|death_place = Vienna, Austria |place of burial= Prague, St. Vitus Cathedral
|religion =Roman Catholic }} 'Ferdinand I' (10 March 1503, AlcalÃ¡ de Henares,
Spain â 25 July 1564, Vienna, Austria) was Holy Roman Emperor from 1558, king of
Bohemia and Hungary from 1526, and king of Croatia from 1527 until his
death. [http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/204-
416/Ferdinand-I Britannica 2009] Milan Kruhek: Cetin,
grad izbornog sabora Kraljevine Hrvatske 1527, KarlovaÄka Å½upanija, 1997,
Karslovac Before his accession, he ruled the Austrian hereditary lands of
the Habsburgs in the name of his elder brother, Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor.

The key events during his reign were the contest with the Ottoman Empire, whose
great advance into Central Europe began in the 1520s, and the Protestant
Reformation, which resulted in several wars of religion.

Ferdinand's motto was : "Let justice be done, though the world perish".
